definition: like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: She kissed my cheek and then smoked into her house.
sentences.chinese: 她亲了一下我的脸颊，然后一溜烟地跑回了家。

sentences.english: And he made his escape at a run to join his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他随即一溜烟跑去追他那些朋友了。

sentences.english: She slipped out the door and disappeared into the dark barn .
sentences.chinese: 她一溜烟走出门外，隐没在马房的黑暗中。

sentences.english: When they saw you coming,they took to their heels.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到你来，一溜烟儿跑了。

sentences.english: The four nuns agree, and run off.
sentences.chinese: 四个修女欣然同意，然后一溜烟跑掉了。

sentences.english: The thief whip round the corner and out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 那个贼一溜烟儿转过街角就看不见了。

sentences.english: Then, taking the money, the thief turned and got clear away swiftly.
sentences.chinese: 这时，骗子带着钱袋，转身一溜烟地逃得无影无踪。

sentences.english: Tang Seng has been a crime, fell ran.
sentences.chinese: 说罢，唐僧告了个罪，一溜烟跑了。

sentences.english: The small milk wraps to fill to blue small sea in 11 hands and away and disappear run have no trace and shadow.
sentences.chinese: 小奶包把小海蓝塞到十一手中，一溜烟跑得无踪影了。

to run like the wind/to rush/to gallop

to break into a run
